summary: The National Biotechnology Initiative Act of 2025 establishes a national initiative to advance biotechnology in the United States. It mandates the President, through the Executive Office of the President, to coordinate federal activities related to biotechnology, encompassing research, development, commercialization, workforce development, and international partnerships. A National Biotechnology Coordination Office and an Interagency Committee are to be established to oversee and coordinate these efforts. The bill outlines the responsibilities of participating agencies, focusing on promoting national security, economic productivity, and global competitiveness through biotechnology.
